p: Since the surface energy and surface roughness depend on the contact angle values, its determination can reveal the typical surface properties of a membrane. A rough surface is significant while constructing superhydrophobic surfaces [ 40, 41]. The obtained average contact angle values for all nanocomposites are shown in Figure 3a. From Figure 3a, it is clear that pure PS nanofibers exhibited a hydrophobic nature with a contact angle of 140Â°, whereas the nanocomposites, showed enhanced hydrophobicity with larger contact angle values.
